page.title: 05BIRD AVIARIES/LILFORD PARK 2
page.content: It holds native and exotic birds.The flamingo pen covers ten acres with a collection of waterfowl, storks and cormorants.By the hundreds of aviaries are recent huts where eggs of the birds are reared in incubators until they are hatched.They are then fed for up to three months and then finally put out into the aviaries. There is also a rat store where the rats are kept ready to feed to vultures and owls. On 4th year work experience some P.W.S. students had to chop up rats for the vultures! The visitors roaming around Lilford Park will more than likely come across either some wild hungry ducks or some very noisy male and female peacocks. There is one rule that every visitor must comply with and that is..... { DO NOT FEED THE ANIMALS { THEY MAY BITE YOU!
